body:
this may have not been what i first suspected.  after working with this issue i'm left wondering how owncloud handles a merge when folder names match but in a different case.

my problems above seem to stem from the theory of a deadman directory name being "theory of a deadman" on one client while "theory of a deadman" on another.

i also have a similar issue with another itunes directory name called on one client "puddle of mudd" and "puddle of mudd" on another.

the difference of case seems to confuse the service resulting in empty directories and failed csyncs.

i've only corrected the issue on my clients about 1 hour ago and things seem to be working as expected.
there are some definitely case-sensitivity issues going on, at least for me. i've now found a handful of directories where this is happening.
@danimo can i ask you to have a look? involves mac and desktop client. but i'm not sure if this is server or client related thx

i'm posting some more logs in hopes that this will be helpful. i've verified what is happening and it is a case sensitivity issue.  itunes isn't helping either. itunes is trying to keep my media organized so it will rename a directory based on the artist meta-data, changing the case depending on how the metadata was entered. i found fixing this and fixing the files will stablize owncloud syncs.  however, here is some logging of the errors:

[mon dec 24 12:25:40 2012] [error] [client 10.0.1.203] php warning:  fopen(/users/majorsl/owncloudserver/data/majorsl/files/itunes/itunes media/music/puddle of mudd/come clean/06 she hates me.mp3): failed to open stream: no such file or directory in /users/majorsl/owncloudserver/lib/filestorage/local.php on line 112

i've updated all clients to the 1.2b1 client with the same results.
could you test it with the latest clients? 1.2 ? thanks
i've been using the 1.2 client since b1.  same issue, even with release 1.2.  thanks for taking a look.

i just installed 1.2.1 and i'm facing a related issue. 

using 1.2.0 i had a directory gulliver on my client machine and it was synced with the server.
after updating to 1.2.1 there was an duplicate directory on the server named `gulliver`, next to the original `gulliver`, with the same content.
stupidly enough i removed the `gulliver` directory from the server and kept `gulliver` on the server.
then the sync came and removed `gulliver` from my client! whoops. all gone.

my analysis is that for some reason the owncloud-client did not recognize the uppercase name `gulliver` directory on the server and created a new one with a lowercase name. it kept `gulliver` on the client machine insync with `gulliver` on the server. 

this is nasty.

thanks
there is no handling of case conflicts in owncloud. we need to find a good way to handle this, and this is imho not only a client matter.

but i don't understand why there was a case conflict in the first place. `gulliver` on the client machine was in sync with `gulliver` on the server. owncloud client v1.2.1 created a `gulliver` directory on the server, next to the existing `gulliver`. only from that moment on you could say there was a case conflict.
neither do i. i am not aware of any changes in this regard in 1.2.1. pulling in @dragotin.

i’m closing this issue because it has been inactive for a few months. this probably means it’s not reproducible or it has been fixed in a newer version.

please reopen if the error still persists with the [latest stable version](http://owncloud.org/install/) (currently owncloud 5.0.9) and then please use the [issue template](https://raw.github.com/owncloud/core/master/issue_template.md). you an also contribute directly by providing a patch – see the [developer manual](http://doc.owncloud.org/server/5.0/developer_manual/). :)

thank you!
